title: Lionel Messi spotted telling referee that Ousmane Dembele "doesn't know how to speak"

Lionel Messi told the referee that Ousmane Dembele "doesn't know how to speak" after he sent the Frenchman off for dissent in Barcelona's 4-0 win over Sevilla.

New footage from the match, which saw Barcelona duo Ronald Araujo and Dembele both given their marching orders, captured the Argentine attempting in vain to defend his team-mate.

Araujo was sent off for a professional foul three minutes from the end of the La Liga fixture, prompting the Barcelona players to surround referee Mateu Lahoz to complain.

Dembele was among them and, according to Spanish media, said to Lahoz: "Eres muy malo", which translates as "you are very bad".

(Image: Twitter)

The comment in English is not particularly offensive, but it carries more weight in Spanish, prompting the referee to brandish a straight red card.

Dembele's Spanish isn't fantastic, and Messi was trying to articulate this point to Lahoz, explaining to the official that the Frenchman didn't mean what he said.

From footage released by Spanish broadcaster Movistar it was determined that Messi told the referee: "No sabe hablar. No sabe hablar", which translates as "he doesn't know how to speak".

But the protests from the five-time Ballon d'Or winner fell on deaf ears.

(Image: REUTERS)

The red card shown to Dembele was the first of his career and could result in the Frenchman facing a two-match ban.

This could see him miss Barcelona's crucial El Clasico clash with Real Madrid on October 26.
description: Footage from the win over Sevilla captured Lionel Messi attempting in vain to defend his Barcelona team-mate
